required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the Treatment of Relapsed or Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: Phase Ⅱ Clinical Trial of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the Treatment of CD19 Positive Relapsed or Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a Phase II, single-arm, open-label, single-dose clinical trial, and its primary objective is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the treatment of CD19 positive Relapsed or Refractory acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a Phase II, single-arm, open-label, single-dose clinical trial, and its primary objective is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the treatment of CD19 positive Relapsed or Refractory acute lymphoblastic leukemia. The study consists of screening period (8 weeks), treatment period (4 weeks), and follow-up period (2 years at most).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Remission Rate (ORR), which includes Complete Remission (CR) and Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery (CRi) as determined by Independent Review Committee (IRC).
primary_outcome.description: The Investigators' evaluation results of ORR will be subjected to sensitivity analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Remission Rate (ORR) with minimal residual disease (MRD) negative bone marrow as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: MRD negative status as determined using flow cytometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Remission Rate (ORR) as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who have achieved CR or CRi.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Remission Rate (ORR) with minimal residual disease (MRD) negative bone marrow as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: MRD negative status as determined using flow cytometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relapse Free Survival (RFS) as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: RFS means the duration from reaching the response CR or CRi to the first defined relapse, or death due to any cause, whichever comes first.

secondary_outcome.measure: Event free survival (EFS) as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: EFS means duration from the CNCT19 Cell Injection infusion to death for any reason after remission, relapse, treatment failure, no response, or termination (because of death, adverse event, lack of efficacy, progression, new anti-tumor treatments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of remission (DOR) as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: DOR means the duration from reaching the response CR or CRi to the first defined relapse, or death due to any cause, whichever comes first.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best overall response (BOR) as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who have achieved the best effect (CR or CRi) after the experimental treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall survival (OS) as determined by IRC and Investigators.
secondary_outcome.description: OS is defined as the time from the CNCT19 Cell Injection infusion to the date of death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: In vivo cellular Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of CNCT19 in units of transgene copy number per genomic DNA (gDNA) amount.
secondary_outcome.description: Characterize the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile in blood, bone marrow (if available) and Cerebral Spinal Fluid (CSF) (if available) by qPCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: In vivo cellular Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of CNCT19 in units of percent of CAR-positive cells.
secondary_outcome.description: Characterize the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile in blood, bone marrow (if available) and Cerebral Spinal Fluid (CSF) (if available) by Flow Cytometry.
Collected as pharmacodynamic data, including IL-6 at list.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of C reactive protein in serum.
Prevalence and incidence of humoral immunogenicity (anti-drug antibodies) to CNCT19.

clinical_study.condition: Relapsed or Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

arm_group.description: A conditioning chemotherapy regimen of fludarabine and cyclophosphamide will be administered followed by investigational treatment, CNCT19.

intervention.description: Dose: 0.5 x 10^8 CNCT19 Cell Injection via intravenous infusion. Drug: Fludarabine Drug: Cyclophosphamide

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

facility.name: The affiliated hospital of Xuzhou medical university
Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital
The First Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University school of Medicine
